Not totally necessary, but this could probably just be expressed with the ternary operator instead.
return bool == null ? DEFAULT : TriState.of(bool.booleanValue());
timeline.author: Vaerian

timeline.bodyText:
Same here, could probably be a ternary. I only mention it because all of the methods in the file are basically the same level of complexity, but some of them use the ternary operator, and some of them just use a traditional if statement. It might be good to just pick one and uniformly use that one.
return this == TriState.DEFAULT ? null : this.get();
